title: Business Intelligence Analyst
content:
Cohesity is on a mission to radically simplify how organizations secure and manage their data, while unlocking limitless value. As a leader in data security and management, we make it easy to secure, protect, manage and derive value from data—across the data center, edge, and cloud. At Cohesity, we're a group of builders and go-getters who are committed to doing the right thing. We encourage you to come as you are, as our differences make us stronger.
We’ve been named a Leader by multiple analyst firms and are prominently featured in the Forbes Cloud 100 and CRN’s Coolest Cloud companies. 
Join us and we'll lead the way together.
Cohesity is on a mission to radically simplify how organizations secure and manage their data, while unlocking limitless value. As a leader in data security and management, we make it easy to secure, protect, manage and derive value from data—across the data center, edge, and cloud. At Cohesity, we're a group of builders and go-getters who are committed to doing the right thing. We encourage you to come as you are, as our differences make us stronger.
We’ve been named a Leader by multiple analyst firms and are prominently featured in the Forbes Cloud 100 and CRN’s Coolest Cloud companies.
Join us and we'll lead the way together.
Job Mission

As a Business Intelligence Analyst in the Office of the CEO, you will be responsible for empowering data driven decision making across the business on strategic, multi-functional projects. You will develop standardized metrics around the company’s growth, and create reporting and visualizations of that data to drive key decisions. You will partner with multi-functional teams on ad-hoc analyses, and provide strategic support to the executive team
The ideal candidate is a highly motivated and resourceful individual who seeks to “tell the story” of the data with little direction or supervision
This role will work closely with marketing and sales teams to explore all avenues of inbound demand and extrapolate insights for teams to action on. This role requires you to be an informed voice to achieve operational excellence and assume ownership of existing marketing dashboards

Responsibilities

Develop a deep understanding of key company growth metrics, reporting tools, and data structure in order to identify and drive resolution of issues, provide actionable intelligence with existing metrics or identify, develop, and propose new metrics, dashboards, scorecards or new tools
Create a standardized repository of growth metrics across the business by collaborating with cross functional stakeholders, such as marketing and sales, to understand their datasets from start to finish and compiling relevant datasets into easy to digest executive level reports
Create both ad hoc and systematic reporting and visualizations of growth related metrics
Conduct analyses and draw actionable conclusions from key metrics tracked for the executive team
Develop, manage, and analyze key marketing funnel metrics to drive growth
Proactively surface potential problems within the marketing funnel and work with Marketing/Sales leaders to create action plans through the GTM Interlock process
Help lead a cross-functional team focused on improving marketing attribution modeling
Manage reporting requirements as project-driven tasks with documented requirements, timelines, and milestones
Partner closely with the data warehouse team to architect data-driven solution to operations reporting requirements
Document techniques and train team members on self-service reporting

Requirements

BA/BS degree in Information Systems, Marketing or related field is desired
At least 3 years experience working with or in marketing operations
5+ years of report development using enterprise reporting tools such as Tableau
At least 3-5 years T-SQL development
Experience with advanced SQL queries
Experience with Looker and/or Google Analytics would be a plus
SQL Server skills including SQL objects development, performance tuning, data analysis, integration and stored procedure development
Experience with the following applications – SFDC, Marketo
Experience delivering reports and dashboards
Ability to create meaningful datasets
Ability to understand, document and communicate business requirements to the technical team
Strong analytical skills
Ability to work quickly/accurately on multiple projects
Must be able to understand end results and provide creative solutions
Excellent communication skills
Proven problem solver

Outcomes

Create executive level reporting around key growth levers across the business
Standardize growth driven metrics across the company
Derive data-driven insights to tackle Cohesity’s most complex strategic problems

Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates:
For information on personal data processing, please see our Privacy Policy.
Equal Employment Opportunity Employer (EEOE)
Cohesity is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law. 
If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at 1-855-9COHESITY or talent@cohesity.com for assistance.
In-Office Expectations
Cohesity employees who are within a reasonable commute (e.g. within a forty-five (45) minute average travel time) work out of our core offices 2-3 days a week of their choosing.
